CERAMICB.MX.long_name: Internacional de Cerámica, S.A.B. de C.V.
CERAMICB.MX.summary: Internacional de CerÃ¡mica, S.A.B. de C.V. engages in the production, marketing, and distribution of ceramic products in Mexico, the United States, China, and Guatemala. The company offers floors and coatings products, including floor tiles, wall tiles, and other special tiles; bathroom products, including sanitary, washbasins, furniture vanities, tubs, watering cans, cancels, taps, and accessories; kitchen products comprising taps, tarjas, and accessories; and as well as installation materials, such as adhesives, nozzles, and accessories; and natural stones. It distributes its products through approximately 300 sales centers; and stores under the Interceramic name, as well as through interceramic.com. The company was formerly known as Internacional de CerÃ¡mica Sociedad AnÃ³nima de Capital Variable and changed its name to Internacional de CerÃ¡mica, S.A.B. de C.V. in 1987. Internacional de CerÃ¡mica, S.A.B. de C.V. was founded in 1978 and is based in Chihuahua, Mexico.

ELEMENT.MX.summary: Elementia, S.A.B. de C.V. produces and sells building materials for the construction sector in the Americas. Its Cement division offers cement CPC 30 R, cement CPC 40, and construction cement products. The company's Metal Products division offers copper and copper-alloy products, such as tapes, sheets, LWC tubes, bars, connections, wires, keys, and forging copper products. Its Building Systems division provides fiber cement and plastic products, including tiles, corrugated roofing, tubes, siding, panels, molding, as well as water tanks, cisterns, septic tanks, seedbeds, coffers, slabs, half shells, plates, disposable cups, and polystyrene sheets. The company sells its products under the Cementos, Fortaleza, Giant, Keystone, Dragon Nacobre, Allura, Mexalit, Plycem, Eternit, Duralit, Fibraforte, and other brand names. The company is based in Mexico City, Mexico.

LAMOSA.MX.summary: Grupo Lamosa, S.A.B. de C.V., together with its subsidiaries, manufactures and commercializes ceramic products for wall and floor coverings, and adhesive in North America, Central America, and South America. It operates in Ceramic and Adhesive segments. The company offers floor and wall coverings, tiles, baseboards, technical porcelain enamel tiles, and special pieces; adhesives for installing wall and floor coverings, grouts, stuccos and texturized finishes, waterproofing materials, and other specialized products, as well as specialized mortars for construction industry needs. It markets its floor and wall tiles under the Lamosa, Porcelanite, Firenze, San Lorenzo, Cordillera, and Ceramica Scop brand names; and adhesives under the Crest, Impercrest, Perdura, Niasa, and Porcelanite brands. The company was founded in 1890 and is based in San Pedro Garza GarcÃ­a, Mexico.
